I had a dream the other night that MTV was running a bunch of old Van Halen videos in order to celebrate the release of Best of Both Worlds. The (faceless) VJ announced that the current video was one of the shortest in the Van Halen pantheon, clocking in at just over a minute. It was an instrumental, and sounded very much like the David Lee Roth version of Van Halen had done an extended version of âRight Nowââpossibly inspired by the latest urlLink Chuck Klosterman article . The amazing was that, in the dream, I watched the video totally coherently from beginning to end. The video was an early one, but was shot on digital video, reality-TV style. It starts with David Lee Roth hitchhiking on a busy street at the bottom of a hill. He catches a ride, but ditches the camera. The cameraman somehow manages to find a ride as well and finally catches up with Roth at the top of the hill, where Roth hang glides off the top of the hill. Hereâs some of the stuff I got from the urlLink dream dictionary to help me decipher it: Camera: Image of experience. Record. Sometimes a means of distancing. Car: Personal power. Ego. Jump: Inconsistent in love affairs. Escape from danger. Adventures. Mountain: Natural elevation of yourself. Aspiration. Success through effort. Music: Big pleasure in life. Rhythm. Harmony. Need to express yourself. Television: Movement. Images. Virtual reality. There is something that you wish to observe. Valley: Life. Protection. Growth. Feeling conformable with the present situation. Voyeurism: Safe distance from desires. Fear of being discovered. â¦so, basically, it looks like I subconsciously envy David Lee Roth for leaving Van Halen to pursue his own creative ambitions. But I also fear him. I think I need to listen to Crazy From the Heat and sort this all out.
